content: seven easy dishcloths black cat basics are designed for beginners using basic stitches and fundamental techniques seven easy dishcloths is a great frst project for someone learning to knit they begin with the most basic knit stitch and then introduce techniques like purl increase decrease and more these dishcloths are a fun project for any knitter and would make a great handmade gift © alanna penk 2021 construction all dishcloths are knit fat in one piece these patterns can be used as a template and you can make your dishcloths larger or smaller by casting on a different amount of stitches and modifying your number of repeats bear in mind if you make your dishcloths a different size the amount of yarn needed will vary have fun and make them your own materials needed yarn sesia windsurf 100% egyptian mercerized cotton dk-weight / 8 ply 108 m/ 118 y per 50 g colours pictured c1= 246 pale sage c2= 1321 barn red c3= 2370 mustard or similar cotton or other plant-fbre blend yarn linen bamboo hemp etc if substituting yarn approx amounts required 324 metres/ 355 yards total to make all 7 dishcloths or approx 46 metres / 50 yards per dishcloth needles 4 mm/us size 6 straight or circular needle any length notions tapestry needle for fnishing gauge gauge is not generally important for dishcloths but i ve still put it here for reference 21 stitches and 34 row= 10 cm / 4 in in garter stitch 21 stitches and 34 row= 10 cm / 4 in in seed stitch 21 stitches and 28 row= 10 cm / 4 in in stockinette stitch abbreviations k= knit kfb= knit into the front of the stitch and then back of the same stitch before slipping yarn off needle 1 stitch increase k2tog= knit the next 2 stitches together 1 stitch decrease p= purl sl 1 wyib= slip the next st from left to right needle without twisting with working yarn in back sl 1 wyif= slip the next st from left to right needle without twisting with working yarn in front ssk= slip the next 2 stitches as if to knit one at a time then insert lh needle into front of rh needle and knit both stitches together through the back 1 stitch decrease sts= stitches © alanna penk 2021 finished measurements finished dishcloths measure approx 18 cm / 7 in wide and 18 cm / 7 in long each instructions 1 garter stitch dishcloth using c1 cast on 36 sts row 1 k work row 1 a total of 58 times or until dishcloth measures approx 18 cm / 7 in long or desired length bind off all sts leaving a tail approx 51 cm / 20 in long and proceed to fnishing instructions 2 seed stitch dishcloth using c2 cast on 37 sts row 1 k1 p1 to 1 stitch before end of row k1 work row 1 a total of 58 times or until dishcloth measures approx
